intro: Helogyne fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered helogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in clusters, giving it the species name "fasciculata." The flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
